meanings.definition: The deliberate killing of a large number of people from a particular nation or ethnic group with the aim of destroying that nation or group.
meanings.sent1: The genocide in the history books was a tragic event.
meanings.sent2: The world came together to condemn the genocide that took place.
meanings.sent3: The movie portrayed a silly version of genocide with cartoon characters.
meanings.sent4: The pollution was a silent genocide on the environment.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the genocide was felt for generations to come.

meanings.definition: The systematic and widespread extermination or attempted extermination of an entire national, racial, religious, or ethnic group.
meanings.sent1: The survivors shared their stories of the genocide with the world.
meanings.sent2: The international community worked to prevent future genocides.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about a fictional genocide of cupcakes in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: The neglect of the historic building was a slow genocide of its architectural beauty.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting depicted the horror of genocide with vivid colors.
